instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message:
i can't find any corrosion and passed ASD. Fan goes high, load osx fine.
however, MRI show CPU Core PECI error sensor error.


where should check next?

[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/dXYRvRB.jpg[/IMG]
    [IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/HgF49JN.jpg[/IMG]

ASD OS show error:

[img]https://i.imgur.com/fyUGkVa.jpg[/img]

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 42644"]diode mode on <SIGNAL>SML_PCH_1_CLK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SML_PCH_1_DATA</SIGNAL>??
[/quote]

sorry, I'm late, now I am back at it again

<SIGNAL>SML_PCH_1_CLK</SIGNAL> = 0.530
<SIGNAL>SML_PCH_1_DATA</SIGNAL> = 0.528

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR>


pin1 <SIGNAL>SMC_PECI_L_R</SIGNAL>. has 50 ohms to ground.


SMC is shorted?

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message:
Remove <RESISTOR>R5052</RESISTOR> to see where the low value remains.
For me, seems to be very low, unusual.
Can you confirm other value from similar board?

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message:
i've removed <RESISTOR>R5052</RESISTOR>, the low value still remains on <SIGNAL>SMC_PECI_L</SIGNAL>. Bad SMC? any more way to confirm it is smc?

i don't have any boards, don't suppose you have 2915 board to check for me?

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message:
Someone gave me the reading from one 3330.
Diode mode aprox .710 with red probe to ground; 1. inverting probes.
His board doesn't work (liquid spill), but the reading should be good.

Do you also get low value at <RESISTOR>R5054</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message:
Diode reading with <RESISTOR>R5052</RESISTOR> removed

pin1 (<SIGNAL>SMC_PECI_L</SIGNAL>) = 0.048

on a known working board i can confirm 0.706 is correct diode mode reading on <SIGNAL>SMC_PECI_L</SIGNAL> with <RESISTOR>R5052</RESISTOR> removed.
i didn't want to waste time, so i had to use the 3330 board that without ethernet,firewire and sd reader because i had to remove <RESISTOR>R3943</RESISTOR> .

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

diode mode on <RESISTOR>R5054</RESISTOR> = 0.245

good board = 0.276

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message: If the PECI issue is on SMC side, change it...

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message: Board is fixed after i replaced the smc. Yes Smc was the culprit ?. Thanks 2informaticos.

threads.title: 3330 - CPU Core PECI
threads.message: You was lucky enough to find a low value to point in a correct direction...
